page.title: 01NUTLEY, ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: Our area includes the villages of Nutley and Fairwarp and Duddleswell. Lying between the churches of St.James the Less at Nutley and Christchurch at Fairwarp is an area of forest of exceptional natural beauty which is of great interest because of its wild life and plants. Only a few truly local people live in the forest, the majoritynow being commuters and retired people. The area is very attractive to tourists, a boon to Londoners in particular because it is half way to the coast: it offers good recreational facilities for naturalists, walkers and horse riders. This area is worthy of continued interest and of protection by conservationists.
